s.comment: "fair chance" is a phrase meaning "good chance", a sense which none of the current definitions provide though "reasonable" in sense 2 is the closest

list.s: Within a day’s walk are a lake and streams with good fishing, especially for trout, and you’ll have a fair chance of spotting some of the park’s wildlife, too — bobcats, coyotes, golden eagles, black bear, spotted skunk, and cougar.

s.comment: "fair game" should be globbed as phrase meaning "acceptable target"

list.s: The life of purity, the supreme fair, Ere he arrive his weary', noontide prick.
If the fair value of the PP&E acquired is less than the fair value of the PP&E surrendered, the PP&E acquired is recognized at its cost and subsequently reduced to its fair value.
If the fair value of the PP&E acquired is more readily determinable than that of the PP&E surrendered, the cost is the fair value of the PP&E acquired.
